oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.

The purpose of this study was to investigate whether a degree taken at a college of technology or a polytechnic was inferior to one taken at university in terms of employment opportunities. The question of whether HNDs are recognised as degree equivalents was also examined.

Main Topics:
Attitudinal/Behavioural Questions
This was a two stage survey, the first questionnaire administered in 1969, the second in 1971.
Questions included in both stages:
Occupation(s): type; nature of firm; salary; promotion prospects; introductory training; source of information about job; starting date.
Questions asked in first stage only:
Occupation(s): reasons for leaving; satisfaction of expectations; reasons for remaining in job; future plans; salary expectation in five years. Attitude to: career choice; qualifications; promotion prospects.
Questions asked in second stage only:
Occupation(s): intention to remain; total number of jobs held since leaving college. Evaluation of usefulness of degree/HND.
Background Variables
Age, sex, marital status, qualifications (where taken, results).
